org.bk.ass.sim

Class Simulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bk.ass.sim.Simulator

  • public class Simulator
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to simulate 2 groups of agents engaging each other. Either use the default constructor which initialized the default behavior or customize the behaviors. Ie. if you want to simulate one group running away while the other uses the default behavior:
    new Simulator(new RetreatBehavior(), new Simulator.RoleBasedBehavior());
    General usage guide:
    1. Create a new Simulator
    2. On each frame, call reset() once
    3. Before each simulation call resetUnits() before adding units
    Be cautious when modifying Agents after they have been added to the simulation.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      static interface  Simulator.Behavior
      Implementations define what action to take for an agent in regards to its allies and/or enemies.
      static class  Simulator.Builder 
      static class  Simulator.RoleBasedBehavior
      Dispatches behaviors based on the role in combat.

      • evalToInt

        public IntEvaluation evalToInt(java.util.function.ToIntFunction<Agent> agentEval)
        Performs a summation of evaluations on agents of player a and b.
        Parameters:
        agentEval - the evaluation function to use
        Returns:
        the sum of evaluations for all agents, accumulated to an IntEvaluation.

      • simulate

        public int simulate()
        Simulates 4 seconds into the future.
        Returns:
        the actual number of frames simulated, 96 if the battle was not decided earlier

      • simulate

        public int simulate(int frames)
        Simulate the given number of frames. If negative, simulation will only stop if one party has no agents left. If units decide to run away, this could be an endless loop - use with care!
        Returns:
        the number of frames left after simulating, usually 0

      • reset

        public void reset()
